# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in split(text, r"\s+"))
        if widthof(current_line) + widthof(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    
    # Add the last line to the result
    push!(lines, current_line)

    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage
text = "This is a very long sentence that we want to wrap to multiple lines with a maximum width of 10 characters."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 10)
println(wrapped_text)
```
In this example, the `wrap_string` function takes a long text and wraps it at a maximum line width of 10 characters. The result is printed out as an example of the usage of the function.
